Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with enough water and show it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water and show it as wilting or not growing well.
The student can show through drawings that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can include observations of plant health in different settings, like a plant being dry or wet in a classroom.
The student can identify and represent patterns through their drawings that demonstrate how lack of water affects plant health.
